metadata.synopsis: The player meets Yenna for the first time. This first interaction is forced so that even an evil player can become attached to her as we need them to form a connection for Yenna to be a potential target for Orin.
metadata.how_to_trigger: BGO_Main_A. First checkpoint in act 3. Walk down the hill and find Yenna and her cat to the right.

30.speaker: Yenna
30.text: Hi! I'm still looking for my mum but - erm - thank you for helping me. You were really nice.
30.context: NodeContext: Responding to 'where did you last see your mum?'

55.speaker: Yenna
55.text: Erm. 'Scuse me. I can't find my mum.
55.context: NodeContext: Responding to 'where did you last see your mum?'

31.speaker: Player
31.text: Where did you last see her?
31.context: NodeContext: Responding to 'where did you last see your mum?'

63.speaker: Yenna
63.text: She was. Erm. She was sick. She had spots on her face and hands. She went to go get some herbs - and she was supposed to come back the same day.
63.context: NodeContext: Responding to 'where did you last see your mum?'

39.speaker: Player
39.text: I don't know where your mum is, but here - take a few coin. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

4.speaker: Yenna
4.text: Oh - erm. Thank you so much! I don't have anything and you can't do anything without any coin.

60.speaker: Yenna
60.text: I'll pay you back. When I find my mum.

3.speaker: Player
3.text: You must be hungry. Take some food.

15.speaker: Yenna
15.text: Wow! Thanks! My mum would like this. She's the best cook in the world. And she taught me too.

28.speaker: Yenna
28.text: I'll - erm - I'll look for her. I think she'll probably come soon.

21.speaker: Player
21.text: Let's go find a guard. They'll be able to help you.

46.speaker: Yenna
46.text: Guards blow like petards. They don't help us.

38.speaker: Player
38.text: This city is a poor place to be in need of help. Even the guards can't be trusted to protect the most vulnerable.

20.speaker: Halsin
20.text: This city is a poor place to be in need of help. Even the guards can't be trusted to protect the most vulnerable.

68.speaker: Player
68.text: It sounds like your mum is probably dead.
68.context: NodeContext: like a kid trying to remember a big word they've heard for the first time

56.speaker: Yenna
56.text: That means you don't come back. My mum is coming back, though. She's looking for me.

73.speaker: Yenna
73.text: If you see her, tell her Yenna's looking for her. It's really scary when you're alone without your mum.

62.speaker: Player
62.text: Let's find the nearest temple, little one. They can help you, I'm sure.
62.context: NodeContext: like a kid trying to remember a big word they've heard for the first time

35.speaker: Yenna
35.text: That's the first thing I did - mum always said to look for a temple if I needed help.
35.context: NodeContext: like a kid trying to remember a big word they've heard for the first time

17.speaker: Yenna
17.text: But they... they said they couldn't help me. 'Cos of the circ... circum... circumstances. That's what they said.
17.context: NodeContext: like a kid trying to remember a big word they've heard for the first time

33.speaker: Player
33.text: Conjure some berries and herbs for the hungry child.
33.context: NodeContext: 'simple is best' as if repeating a maxim taught by her mother

9.speaker: Yenna
9.text: Oh wow! Thank you... Mum loved food like this. 'Simple is best,' she always said.
9.context: NodeContext: 'simple is best' as if repeating a maxim taught by her mother

40.speaker: Player
40.text: Poor child. I can only hope her mother does return - she should not be left alone here.

70.speaker: Halsin
70.text: Poor child. I can only hope her mother does return - she should not be left alone here.

41.speaker: Player
41.context: NodeContext: Reprimanding the player for being dismissive of a child in need.

67.speaker: Yenna
67.text: Yenna! And my cat is Grub. He's shy. I'm not.

10.speaker: Yenna
10.text: My mum is called Emery. She went to go get some herbs - for her spots. She was sick. And she was supposed to come back the same day.

58.speaker: Player
58.text: Tell me where she went, little one - I can try tracking her down.
58.context: NodeContext: Reprimanding the player for being dismissive of a child in need.

48.speaker: Yenna
48.text: She went looking for herbs. That's what she said. Said it was for the spots... she had them all on her hands and face.

77.speaker: Yenna
77.text: She said she wouldn't be gone long... but that was a whole tenday ago.

25.speaker: Player
25.text: *The herbs you know for salving sores would take effect immediately. It seems unlikely this child's mother will return.*

43.speaker: Yenna
43.text: *The herbs you know for salving sores would take effect immediately. It seems unlikely this child's mother will return.*

7.speaker: Narrator
7.text: *The herbs you know for salving sores would take effect immediately. It seems unlikely this child's mother will return.*

16.speaker: Player
16.text: Here, I have some rations to spare. Eat up, child.

54.speaker: Yenna
54.text: Th - thank you! I was getting hungry. Mum made a big stew before she left - she's the best cook ever - but I ate it all.

0.speaker: Player
0.text: I think your mum will be gone for a while. Maybe best find somewhere safe to stay?

57.speaker: Yenna
57.text: It does get quite cold out here... I - erm - I'll have another look for her first.

65.text: Best stay put, child.  I'll have a look for your mother.

61.speaker: Yenna
61.text: Best stay put, child.  I'll have a look for your mother.

74.speaker: Player
74.text: Best stay put, child.  I'll have a look for your mother.

66.speaker: Player
66.context: NodeContext: Reprimanding the player for being dismissive of a child in need.

26.speaker: Player
26.text: That's your problem, kid. Get lost.
26.context: NodeContext: Reprimanding the player for being dismissive of a child in need.

71.speaker: Yenna
71.text: But - erm. I'm. I don't know where to go.
71.context: NodeContext: Reprimanding the player for being dismissive of a child in need.

29.speaker: Player
29.text: If 'get out' not clear enough for you, child, perhaps a flash of my weapon will get the message across.
29.context: NodeContext: Reprimanding the player for being dismissive of a child in need.

44.speaker: Lae'zel
44.text: If 'get out' not clear enough for you, child, perhaps a flash of my weapon will get the message across.
44.context: NodeContext: Reprimanding the player for being dismissive of a child in need.

51.speaker: Shadowheart
51.text: Harsh. Not the family type then, I take it?
51.context: NodeContext: Reprimanding the player for being dismissive of a child in need.

69.speaker: Astarion
69.text: Good, that'll make 'getting lost' even easier. Honestly, kids these days.
69.context: NodeContext: Reprimanding the player for being dismissive of a child in need.

45.speaker: Wyll
45.text: Come now, have a heart. She's only a child.
45.context: NodeContext: Reprimanding the player for being dismissive of a child in need.

52.speaker: Gale
52.text: A tad harsh, don't you think? Our fire will be no cooler just for sharing it with a child in need.
52.context: NodeContext: Reprimanding the player for being dismissive of a child in need.

36.speaker: Karlach
36.text: Ah, come on. What's with you? We have room. Kid needs us.
36.context: NodeContext: Reprimanding the player for being dismissive of a child in need.

19.speaker: Halsin
19.text: She is a child in need of help - let your harsh words go unspoken.
19.context: NodeContext: Reprimanding the player for being dismissive of a child in need.

8.speaker: Jaheira
8.text: Watch your tongue. The girl has suffered cruelty enough without heaping more on her head.
8.context: NodeContext: Snapping at player for bullying child.

49.speaker: Player
49.text: Just stay put, kid. Your mum will come find you soon, I'm sure.

27.speaker: Player
27.text: Just stay put, kid. Your mum will come find you soon, I'm sure.

24.speaker: Yenna
24.text: She better. It's getting really sad in here.

23.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
23.text: The child ignores you. Would you like me to dispose of her?

64.speaker: Yenna
64.text: Oh - erm - hi. My mum is coming - I think.
